channel.title: Academy on Example Academy
channel.description: Recent content in Academy on Example Academy

item.title: Certified Meshery Associate
item.description: This is the entry-level certification for professionals new to Meshery. It validates a candidate’s foundational knowledge of the platform’s core concepts.

item.title: Meshery CLI (mesheryctl) Contributor Exam
item.description:
The Meshery CLI examination verifies contributor understanding of one of Meshery’s core architectural components and is one of a set of mandatory exams comprising the Certified Meshery Contributor certification.

This exam focuses on the candidate’s ability to contribute to the Meshery CLI codebase. The exam covers a variety of topics, including:

  • Meshery CLI Contributing Guidelines - Design principles and code conventions.
  • Contributing to Meshery CLI - How to contribute to Meshery Command Line Interface.
  • Contributing to Meshery CLI End-to-End Tests - How to contribute to Meshery Command Line Interface end-to-end testing with BATS.

This exam does not cover Meshery CLI usage. For information on using Meshery CLI, please refer to the following resources:

item.title: Content Formatting Examples
item.description:
Welcome! This page showcases examples of Hugo shortcodes, images, and Markdown.

Example Page: Not for Production

This page will not be published in the production version of the site. It is only visible for local preview and serves as a reference. You can safely delete this page from your repository at any time.

item.title: Meshery Extensibility Contributor Exam
item.description:
The Meshery Extensibility examination verifies contributor understanding of one of Meshery’s core architectural frameworks and is one of a set of mandatory exams comprising the Certified Meshery Contributor certification.

The exam covers a variety of topics, including:

  • Contributing to Meshery Adapters
  • Meshery UI Extensibility
  • Authorization Extensibility
  • Using Meshery APIs
  • Local and Remote Providers

item.title: Meshery Models Contributor Exam
item.description:
The Meshery Models examination verifies contributor understanding of one of Meshery’s core architectural components and is one of a set of mandatory exams comprising the Certified Meshery Contributor certification.

The exam covers a variety of topics, including:

  • Contributing to Models Quick Start
  • Contributing to Meshery Models
  • Contributing to Model Components
  • Contributing to Model Relationships
  • Contributing to Meshery Policies

Supplemental topics:

  • Concepts of Meshery Models

item.title: Meshery Server Contributor Exam
item.description:
The Meshery Server examination verifies contributor understanding of one of Meshery’s core architectural components and is one of a set of mandatory exams comprising the Certified Meshery Contributor certification.

This exam focuses on the candidate’s ability to contribute to the Meshery Server codebase. The exam covers a variety of topics, including:

  • Contributing to Meshery Server
  • Contributing to Meshery Server Events
  • How to write MeshKit Compatible Errors
  • Build & Release (CI)
  • Schema-driven development in Meshery

This exam does not cover Meshery Server usage, but focuses on Meshery Server contribution. For information on using Meshery Server, please refer to the Meshery Documentation.

item.title: Meshery UI Contributor Exam
item.description:
The Meshery UI examination verifies contributor understanding of one of Meshery’s core architectural components and is one of a set of mandatory exams comprising the Certified Meshery Contributor certification.

  • Contributing to Meshery UI
  • Contributing to Meshery UI - Notification Center
  • Schema-Driven UI Development in Meshery
  • Contributing to Meshery UI - Sistent
  • Contributing to Meshery UI End-to-End Tests
  • Contributing to Meshery UI - Dashboard Widgets

This exam does not cover Meshery UI usage, but focuses on Meshery UI contribution. For information on using Meshery UI, please refer to the Meshery Documentation.
